input.name: __EVENTVALIDATION

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-family: tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #20124d;

span.strong: The Cameron ISD community must work together to fight COVID-19. Head to http://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.

div.a: Cameron ISD School Closed for the Remainder of the Year

div.div: Dear Cameron ISD Community Given the potential community health and safety concerns due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and the guidance we have received today, 4-17-2020, from the Governor of Texas, Cameron ISD will remain closed, along with all districts in the State of Texas, through the end of the 2019-2020 academic year. CISD currently offers remote learning opportunities for our students via our digital learning platform. The district also offers printed learning packets for students with issues...Read more...

div.a: Cameron ISD School Closure through May 1, 2020

div.div: Dear Cameron ISD Community Given the potential community health and safety concerns due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and the guidance we have received today from the Governor of Texas, Milam County Judge Steve Young, the Milam County Health Department and County officials, Cameron ISD will remain closed, along with all districts in the State of Texas, through May 1, 2020. CISD currently offers remote learning opportunities for our students via our digital learning platform. The district also offers...Read more...

div.span: CISD AT HOME CURRICULUM BY GRADE

span.style: background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; font-size: 16px; color: #14171a;

p.span: Texas, remember the importance of social distancing. If you must go out, avoid public spaces and keep your distance from others (at least 6 feet). If we continue to follow valuable public health guidance, fewer of our friends & family will be affected by COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas

Texas, recuerda la importancia del distanciamiento social. Evite espacios públicos y manténgase alejado de los demás (al menos 6 pies). Si continuamos siguiendo la guía de salud pública, menos de nuestros amigos y familiares se verán afectados por COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas

People with no symptoms have the potential to unknowingly spread COVID-19! That’s why it’s best for everyone in your family to stay at home and away from others as much as possible until instructed otherwise from state and local officials. #StayHomeTexas

div.p: ¡Las personas sin síntomas tienen el potencial de propagar COVID-19 sin saberlo! Por eso lo mejor para todos en su familia es quedarse en casa y lejos de los demás tanto como sea posible hasta que los funcionarios estatales y locales le indiquen lo contrario. #StayHomeTexas

span.strong: Coughing & sneezing can send tiny infected

p.span: droplets into the air which can be inhaled by anyone within 6 feet of us. Always cough or sneeze into a tissue or your elbow and immediately wash your hands to lessen the risk of spreading the virus. Be smart. Stay well! #StayHomeTexas

div.p: Toser y estornudar puede llevar gotas infectadas al aire, que pueden ser inhaladas por personas que este´n a 6 pies de ti. Siempre tosa o estornude en pañuelos desechables o en el codo y lávese las manos para disminuir la propagación del virus. ¡Mantente sano! #StayHomeTexas

p.span: The virus lives in tiny droplets in the lungs of people w/ COVID-19, even when they don’t show symptoms. We can breathe the same air as anyone within abt. 6 ft. of us. Staying farther apart from people during this time reduces the chance of breathing in the virus. #StayHomeTexas

div.p: El virus vive en gotas en los pulmones de personas con COVID-19, y a veces no tienen síntomas. Puedes respirar el mismo aire que cualquiera a 6 pies de ti. Mantente más alejado de las personas durante este tiempo para reducir la posibilidad de respirar el virus. #StayHomeTexas

span.style: background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; color: #14171a;
span.strong: CDC now recommends you wear a mask in public where you can’t avoid being near people, like in grocery stores, pharmacies & healthcare settings

span.style: background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; color: #14171a;

p.span: . Remember though, your local authorities may have already issued a specific order re: masks.

div.p: CDC recomienda que use una máscara en público donde no pueda evitar estar cerca de personas, como en supermercados, farmacias y centros de salud https://bit.ly/2V8o5Y2. Es posible que sus autoridades locales ya hayan hecho obligatorio el uso de máscaras. #StayHomeTexas

div.div: Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & stay home. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately. #StayHomeTexas Los síntomas comunes de #COVID19 son fiebre, tos seca y dificultad para respirar.Si tiene síntomas leves, llame a su médico y quedate en casa.Si desarrolla síntomas graves, como dificultad para respirar o presión en el pecho, busque atención médica de inmediato. #StayHomeTexas

label.span: How long will Cameron ISD be closed?

div.div: This is a developing and very fluid situation. Cameron ISD is in daily contact with the Texas Education Agency, Milam County officials and local health officials regarding COVID-19. The district will continue to make decisions that are in the best interest of the health and safety of our school community.

label.span: Will this closure impact STAAR testing?

div.div: Texas' Governor, Greg Abbott, has waived all STAAR testing requirements for the 2019-2020 school year due to COVID-19.
Social distancing is simply keeping your distance from others, even by a few feet. Health officials say this is one of the best ways we can prevent the spread of COVID-19.

label.span: What can I do if my child is scared or anxious?

div.div: Talking to your children about COVID-19 can be difficult. To help, we've created this page including resources from counselors & psychologists: http://bit.ly/2UdAlG7

label.span: How can my child continue his/her instruction at home?

div.div: Please see the CISD At Home Curriculum by Grade located on the COVID-19 Update Center Homepage.

em.span: Follow Cameron I.S.D. on Facebook for more information and updates!
